messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] "the" seamless school system
messages.msgSnippet: in response to the heated hyperbole people will roll their eyes and dismiss (WHOEVER) as a credible source of information. Probably not the desired outcome. As
messages.messageBody:
in response to the heated hyperbole people will roll
their eyes and dismiss (WHOEVER) as a credible source of information.
Probably not the desired outcome.

As a reader of the "Alternative Press" I run into this very often. It is
hard for me to read beneath so much hyperbole and I am frequently in
agreement with the message. Imagine how the people who don't already agree
feel about reading the same.
I am much more likely to listen to a conservative christian when they speak
calmly and with as little inflammatory rhetoric as possible.
~Elissa Cleaveland
Radical Unschoolers Unite!

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] "the" seamless school system
messages.msgSnippet: **When you say the school system is seamless you remove the possibility that your other information could be valid.  One bit of nonsense casts doubt on the
messages.messageBody:
**When you say "the school system is seamless" you remove the
possibility that
your other information could be valid. One bit of nonsense casts doubt
on
the rest of the information.

As you're really intent on getting your message across, Ned, I would
encourage you to edit out they hyperbole for the sake of the integrity
of all
you're saying which IS true.**


Yeah, I think that in response to the heated hyperbole people will roll
their eyes and dismiss him as a credible source of information.
Probably not the desired outcome.

Betsy

messages.subject: "the" seamless school system
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/16/02 3:54:51 PM, nedvare@ntplx.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/16/02 3:54:51 PM, nedvare@... writes:

<< Since the school system is seamless, every thread
(topic) leads to the central problem that the system is a fraud. >>

When you say "the school system is seamless" you remove the possibility that
your other information could be valid. One bit of nonsense casts doubt on
the rest of the information.

As you're really intent on getting your message across, Ned, I would
encourage you to edit out they hyperbole for the sake of the integrity of all
you're saying which IS true.

Sandra
